title: Spec-driven feature development
description: Create a detailed spec first, get approval, then implement. Ona breaks down complex features into reviewable steps before writing code.
content:
I need to build [feature description].

First, create a spec.md with:
- Problem statement and user impact
- Technical approach and architecture decisions
- API contracts and data models
- Edge cases and error handling
- Testing strategy

Wait for my approval before implementing. Once approved, implement the feature following the spec exactly, with tests and documentation.
exampleOutput: Created spec.md with 5 sections. Awaiting approval. [After approval] Implemented feature with 12 files, 94% test coverage.

title: Generate sprint standup from Linear
description: Pull your assigned issues from Linear and generate a formatted standup update with blockers and progress.
content:
Check Linear for my assigned issues in the current sprint.

Generate a standup update with:
- What I completed yesterday (issues moved to Done)
- What I'm working on today (In Progress issues)
- Any blockers (issues with blocker labels or stale for 3+ days)

Format it for Slack with issue links.
exampleOutput:
Yesterday: Completed DEV-234 (auth fix), DEV-245 (API endpoint)
Today: Working on DEV-256 (dashboard redesign)
Blockers: DEV-267 waiting on design review

title: Investigate Sentry error and fix
description: Pull error details from Sentry, trace to source code, identify root cause, and create a fix with tests.
content:
Investigate Sentry issue [ISSUE_ID or paste error].

1. Pull the full stack trace and error context from Sentry
2. Find the source code location and recent changes (git blame)
3. Identify the root cause
4. Create a fix with appropriate error handling
5. Add a regression test
6. Create a PR with the fix
exampleOutput: Sentry issue PROJ-1234: NullPointerException in UserService.ts:45. Root cause: user.profile accessed before null check. Created PR #567 with fix and test.

title: Enterprise code review with standards
description: Review PR against your team's coding standards, security policies, and architectural guidelines. Ona uses your team's specs for consistent reviews.
content:
Review this PR following our team standards:

1. Check against our coding standards in CONTRIBUTING.md
2. Verify security best practices (no secrets, proper auth, input validation)
3. Ensure architectural consistency with existing patterns
4. Check test coverage meets our 80% threshold
5. Verify documentation is updated
6. Flag any breaking changes

Leave inline comments for issues and approve if standards are met.
exampleOutput: Review complete: 2 security suggestions (line 45, 78), 1 test coverage gap, 1 doc update needed. Left inline comments.

title: Update dependency across all repos
description: Update a specific dependency across multiple repositories in parallel, handling breaking changes and running tests.
content:
Update [package-name] from [old-version] to [new-version] across all repositories that use it.

For each repo:
1. Check if the package is used
2. Update the dependency
3. Apply any migration steps from the changelog
4. Run the test suite
5. Create a PR if tests pass

Provide a summary of all repos updated and any that failed.
exampleOutput: Updated lodash 4.17.15 to 4.17.21 across 34 repositories. 32 PRs created (tests passing), 2 repos need manual migration (breaking changes in date handling).

title: Remediate CVE across codebase
description: Scan for a specific CVE, patch affected repos in parallel, run tests, and create PRs. Goes beyond bumping versions to actually migrate code.
content:
Remediate [CVE-ID] across all affected repositories.

1. Scan all repos for the vulnerable package/version
2. For each affected repo:
   - Update to the patched version
   - Apply any required code migrations
   - Run the full test suite
   - Create a PR with detailed changelog
3. Generate a compliance report of all remediations
exampleOutput: CVE-2024-1234 remediated in 47 repositories. 45 PRs created (auto-mergeable), 2 require manual review (breaking API changes). Compliance report generated.

title: Migrate Java 8 to Java 17
description: Upgrade Java version across services, handling deprecated APIs, new language features, and build configuration changes.
content:
Migrate this service from Java 8 to Java 17:

1. Update build.gradle/pom.xml for Java 17
2. Replace deprecated APIs (javax to jakarta, etc.)
3. Update to compatible library versions
4. Apply new language features where beneficial (records, sealed classes)
5. Update Dockerfile and CI configuration
6. Run full test suite and fix any failures
7. Document breaking changes
exampleOutput: Migrated to Java 17: Updated 156 files, replaced 23 deprecated APIs, updated 12 dependencies. All 234 tests passing. Created migration notes.

title: GitLab to GitHub repository migration
description: Migrate repository from GitLab to GitHub including CI/CD pipelines, issues, and branch protections.
content:
Migrate this repository from GitLab to GitHub:

1. Convert .gitlab-ci.yml to GitHub Actions workflows
2. Migrate CI/CD secrets and variables
3. Update any GitLab-specific URLs in code and docs
4. Set up equivalent branch protection rules
5. Configure GitHub-specific features (Dependabot, code scanning)
6. Create migration checklist and verify all features work
exampleOutput: Migration complete: Converted 3 CI pipelines to GitHub Actions, migrated 12 secrets, updated 45 URLs. Branch protections configured. Dependabot enabled.

title: Generate DORA metrics report
description: Calculate DORA metrics (deployment frequency, lead time, MTTR, change failure rate) from your Git and CI/CD data.
content:
Generate a DORA metrics report for the last [quarter/month]:

1. Deployment Frequency: Count production deployments
2. Lead Time for Changes: Time from commit to production
3. Mean Time to Recovery: Time to resolve incidents
4. Change Failure Rate: Percentage of deployments causing incidents

Compare to previous period and industry benchmarks. Identify areas for improvement.
exampleOutput: Q4 DORA Report: Deployment Frequency: 12/day (Elite), Lead Time: 2.3 days (High), MTTR: 1.2 hours (Elite), Change Failure Rate: 8% (High). Recommendation: Focus on reducing lead time.

title: Add observability to service
description: Add standardized logging, metrics, and tracing to a service following your organization's observability patterns.
content:
Add observability to this service following our standards:

1. Structured logging with correlation IDs
2. Prometheus metrics for key operations (latency, error rate, throughput)
3. OpenTelemetry tracing for distributed requests
4. Health check endpoints (/health, /ready)
5. Dashboards and alerts configuration

Follow the patterns in our observability-template repo.
exampleOutput: Added observability: 12 structured log points, 8 Prometheus metrics, OpenTelemetry tracing configured, health endpoints added. Grafana dashboard template created.

title: Generate typed API client from OpenAPI
description: Generate a fully typed API client from an OpenAPI spec with error handling, retries, and authentication.
content:
Generate a TypeScript API client from this OpenAPI spec:

1. Create typed request/response interfaces
2. Implement all endpoints with proper HTTP methods
3. Add authentication header injection
4. Include retry logic with exponential backoff
5. Add request/response logging
6. Generate usage examples and documentation
exampleOutput: Generated ApiClient with 24 typed endpoints, auth middleware, retry logic (3 attempts, exponential backoff), and JSDoc documentation.

title: Generate incident postmortem
description: Gather incident data from PagerDuty/Slack, analyze the timeline, and generate a blameless postmortem document.
content:
Generate a postmortem for incident [INCIDENT_ID]:

1. Pull timeline from PagerDuty/alerting system
2. Gather relevant Slack threads and decisions
3. Identify root cause from logs and code changes
4. Document impact (duration, affected users, revenue)
5. List action items to prevent recurrence
6. Format as our standard postmortem template
exampleOutput: Postmortem generated: 45-minute outage, root cause: database connection pool exhaustion. 3 action items: increase pool size, add connection monitoring, update runbook.

title: Generate Backstage catalog entries
description: Analyze repositories and generate Backstage catalog-info.yaml files with accurate metadata, ownership, and dependencies.
content:
Generate Backstage catalog entries for all repositories:

1. Analyze each repo's structure and purpose
2. Identify the owning team from CODEOWNERS or git history
3. Detect dependencies and downstream consumers
4. Generate catalog-info.yaml with:
   - Component metadata
   - API definitions
   - Documentation links
   - Team ownership
5. Create PRs for each repo
exampleOutput: Generated catalog-info.yaml for 89 repositories. Identified 12 APIs, 45 services, 32 libraries. Created PRs with ownership mapped to 8 teams.

title: Prepare compliance audit documentation
description: Gather evidence for SOC2/ISO27001 audits by documenting access controls, change management, and security practices.
content:
Prepare documentation for [SOC2/ISO27001] audit:

1. Document access control policies and current permissions
2. Generate change management evidence (PR reviews, approvals)
3. List security scanning results and remediation status
4. Document incident response procedures and recent incidents
5. Verify encryption at rest and in transit
6. Generate audit-ready report with evidence links
exampleOutput: Audit prep complete: 156 PRs with required approvals, 0 critical vulnerabilities open, encryption verified on 12 services. Report generated with 45 evidence links.

title: Document legacy codebase
description: Analyze undocumented legacy code and generate comprehensive documentation including architecture diagrams and API docs.
content:
Document this legacy codebase:

1. Analyze the code structure and identify key components
2. Generate architecture overview with component relationships
3. Document all public APIs with parameters and return types
4. Identify and document business logic and domain concepts
5. Create onboarding guide for new developers
6. Add inline comments for complex or non-obvious code
exampleOutput: Generated: Architecture diagram (12 components), API documentation (34 endpoints), onboarding guide (8 sections), 156 inline comments added.

title: Improve test coverage to target
description: Analyze coverage gaps and generate tests to reach your target coverage percentage, prioritizing critical paths.
content:
Improve test coverage to [target]% (currently [current]%):

1. Analyze current coverage report
2. Identify untested critical paths (auth, payments, data mutations)
3. Generate unit tests for uncovered functions
4. Add integration tests for untested API endpoints
5. Prioritize tests by risk and complexity
6. Run full suite and verify coverage target is met
exampleOutput: Coverage improved from 62% to 85%. Added 47 unit tests, 12 integration tests. Critical paths now at 95% coverage.
